    • Constructor Detail

      • Quest

        public Quest(Ontology tbox,
             Properties config)
        Will prepare an instance of Quest in "classic ABox mode", that is, to work as a triple store. The property "org.obda.owlreformulationplatform.aboxmode" must be set to "classic".

        You must still call setupRepository() after creating the instance.

        Parameters:
        tbox -
        config -

      • Quest

        public Quest(Ontology tbox,
             OBDAModel mappings,
             Properties config)

      • Quest

        public Quest(Ontology tbox,
             OBDAModel obdaModel,
             DBMetadata metadata,
             Properties config)
        Will prepare an instance of quest in classic or virtual ABox mode. If the mappings are not null, then org.obda.owlreformulationplatform.aboxmode must be set to "virtual", if they are null it must be set to "classic".

        You must still call setupRepository() after creating the instance.

        Parameters:
        tbox - . The TBox must not be null, even if its empty. At least, the TBox must define all the vocabulary of the system.
        obdaModel - . The mappings of the system. The vocabulary of the mappings must be subset or equal to the vocabulary of the ontology.
        config - . The configuration parameters for quest. See QuestDefaults.properties for a description (in src/main/resources)

      • setImplicitDBConstraints

        public void setImplicitDBConstraints(ImplicitDBConstraintsReader userConstraints)
        Supply user constraints: that is primary and foreign keys not in the database Can be useful for eliminating self-joins
        Parameters:
        userConstraints - User supplied primary and foreign keys (only useful if these are not in the metadata) May be used by ontop to eliminate self-joins

      • getConnection

        public QuestConnection getConnection()
                              throws OBDAException
        Returns a QuestConnection, the main object that a client should use to access the query answering services of Quest. With the QuestConnection you can get a QuestStatement to execute queries.

        Note, the QuestConnection is not a normal JDBC connection. It is a wrapper of one of the N JDBC connections that quest's connection pool starts on initialization. Calling .close() will not actually close the connection, with will just release it back to the pool.

        to close all connections you must call Quest.close().

        Returns:
        Throws:
        OBDAException
